channel.title: AndreStork's Blog
channel.description: A blog where I write random things about tech and maybe other stuff too.

item.title: Trying to jailbreak an old LG Bluray Player
item.description: I have an old LG Blu-ray Player laying around, it's the BP450 model and it supports some streaming apps, but it's limited to Netflix and YouTube and there's no App Store, so can I mod it to load third party stuff?

item.title: My favorite Material Design 3 apps of August 2023
item.description: As some of you might know, I'm a Material 3/Material You fan; so, obviously, I'm interested in apps that use it and I might end up using them daily, so this month I'm starting an occasional format on which I will list some of my favorite Material Design 3 apps.

item.title: RCS now sucks
item.description: Yes, the man who always loved RCS and found any reason to talk about it, finishes for hating it. Read the full article to know why.

item.title: ONIMAI: it's not that bad as you might think
item.description: I've lately began to get into CGDCT animes in the last weeks and the fault is mainly K-ON's. At the end I decided to begin with "ONIMAI: I'm Now Your Sister", based on the Nekotofu's manga of the same name, because a video that I saw inspired me to watch it. Read the full article to learn more about my watching pleasure.

item.title: RCS deserves more attention
item.description: In the last post I described how WhatsApp is bad and suggested to use RCS instead. And while it is true that RCS is really cool, it has many problems and a lot of them exist just because we don't consider it enough in the modern days of instant messaging apps.

item.title: WhatsApp sucks. Why? And what should be done about it?
item.description: So, if you live outside the U.S., thereâ€™s a very high chance that WhatsApp is the main messaging application that you and every other people use, but I have a bunch of things to say about it

item.title: ChromeOS: a review by a Windows (and occasional Linux) user
item.description: For a couple of months now I've been using ChromeOS on my Huawei Matebook 14 and there are a lot of things I have to say.
